Went to Morocco, relearned Maydays (pivot to fakie) and caught this guy making his first kickflip. He was at the skatepark alone, we shared this moment and then he was gone. No words were exchanged but we both left smiling. This is skateboarding, all are welcome. https://t.co/1VQcavcR0B

My apologies to Jake Wood & Wendy Leonelli, who I just learned were with me in the elevator. They are not a couple (as a falsely assumed), but colleagues who were in Billings meeting with city leadership to work on their affordable housing crisis. Dunno about the other dude.

While youâ€™re here, watch â€œUntil The Wheels Fall Offâ€ on @HBO. I promise there arenâ€™t any tales of mistaken identity. This is like me telling you to listen to my SoundCloud, if SoundCloud were a documentary about my career that I didnâ€™t make.
@Kevin_805_ Yes, by the first guy. But not the second

(elevator stops, couple exits to their floor)
Other guy: â€œwhatâ€™s the joke?â€
Me: I get mistaken identity a lot
Him: â€œmistaken for who?â€
Me: Tony Hawk
Him: â€œhaha you do look like him!â€
Elevator stops again, he exits on his floor. I am left alone, heading upwards & feeling perplexed

This just happened, and maybe this is where it all ends:
Got an elevator with 3 people.
One guy (with his wife), sarcastically: â€œanyone ever tell you youâ€¦â€ and stops.
Me (amused): yes, but youâ€™re the first today.
His wife: â€œIâ€™m sorry, I tried to stop him from doing the jokeâ€
Thank you @jackholmes0 for this honest, insightful article. And more importantly, for thoroughly covering the @wesleysnipes meme.
@PixieSwift73 @jackinielsen Sam's BFF
@HouseFuzz @samjones @plummsies Reese Nelson, Rafae Ueda, AO, Mami Tezuka
Sam Jones with a companion piece Q&A for viewers of UTWFO:

Thanks to Sam Jones & Greg Finton for telling my story, and for showcasing skateboarding in a truly authentic way. I hope it inspires people to follow their dreams & make positive change, or at least give insight as to why we are obsessed with riding a wooden plank with 4 wheels.
Here is an example of that mindset: this is the last trick I learned (created?) only a week before I broke my leg: Cab body varial to 5-0 to fakie. https://t.co/lOw1VNOs7C

both physically and emotionally, for being singularly focused on something. I hope that it gives some perspective on why we do this and why I havenâ€™t quit; itâ€™s never been for fame or fortune (as they were not rewarded to skaters when I started), but Iâ€™ve had my share of both

through this journey and neither compares to the feeling of riding away from a trick that youâ€™ve battled for hours, weeks or years. I continue to do it because I can still be creative in a way gives me a personal sense of pride and validation.

Tonight is the HBO release of â€œUntil The Wheels Fall Off.â€ It is not only about my life/career, but about the essence of skateboarding. Itâ€™s about being an outcast, getting bullied, forging your own path, not giving up, the trappings of success and the price you pay,
Hyped to be involved in this!
I was spared. Life is good. https://t.co/R2KzIyvIfi

And the Oscar goes toâ€¦

@Ectofriend @RebelTaxi Yes, itâ€™s a long story. The brief version is that I was unknowingly locked into a contract by an overzealous agent. So we made something to fulfill that contract on a tight timeline. Strange days.
@RebelTaxi I was flabbergasted when it was snubbed for a nomination.
@Falloran13 Unfortunately, it wasn't a franchise. Quantity over quality.
(Iâ€™m presenting, btw)
If being in every Jackass movie, xXx, Police Academy 4 and Sharknado 5 doesnâ€™t qualify me to present at the Oscars, then your taste in movies needs readjusting.

Thanks to everyone for the heartfelt well wishes over the last 6 days. Itâ€™s been a whirlwind of emotions like no other. Iâ€™m making improvements each day but it will be a rough road ahead. The wheels have not fallen off just yet.
@TheResoluteLife Thank you! Will is now my inspiration to get back out there
@RZ1Dog @HBO @samjones Thatâ€™s what I get for using the magic wand filter with wild abandon.

It is about my life & career, with a strong focus on the philosophy of how I/we do this at our age. The answer is nuanced, but itâ€™s mostly because I found my sense of purpose and shaped my identity through skating, and it keeps me sane.

Iâ€™ve said many times that I wonâ€™t stop skating until I am physically unable. A broken leg - with plenty of hardware - will probably be the biggest test of that creed. Iâ€™ll be backâ€¦ maybe not at full capacity but I resigned to that notion years ago as I approached â€œmid-life.â€

Thanks to my unyieldingly supportive (and tolerant) family - and all of you - for the love and support through the years; I wouldnâ€™t be here without you. See you on the other side. ğŸ¦…ğŸ›¹
